description: Installation of a splash pad to the bowling green and amendments to the bowling pavilion to create water treatment plantroom with new toilet and showering facilities.
decision_conditions: <p>Prior to commencement of the relevant part of the development details of all soft landscaping proposed and a programme for the approved scheme's implementation and long term management should be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This shall include details of all trees and other planting showing location, species, type of stock, numbers of trees/plants, and areas to be seeded or turfed. The soft landscape scheme shall include the retention of the veteran horse chestnut tree, hedgerow and lying dead wood within the site, as identified in the plan of main habitats contained in the approved Phase 1 Habitat Survey and Protected Species Assessment and the implementation and the long term management plan shall include long term management responsibilities and maintenance schedules for all landscape areas. All soft landscaping in accordance with the scheme, when approved, shall be carried out within a period of twelve months from the date on which the development of the site commences or shall be carried out in the first planting (and seeding) season following completion of the development, and shall be maintained in perpetuity, such maintenance to include the replacement of any plants that die, or are severely damaged, seriously diseased, or removed. </p><p>REASON: To enhance the character, appearance and ecology of the development and contribution to green infrastructure and ensure the protection of habitats of biodiversity value.</p>

No development shall commence, other than works of demolition until full detailed specification of the sustainable drainage system supported by appropriate calculations, construction details, drainage layout and a site-specific management and maintenance plan has been provided. Details shall include but not limited to the proposed raingarden, swales, overflow and flow control details, which shall be submitted and approved by the LPA in consultation with the LLFA. Surface water from the site shall be managed according to the proposal referred to in the Drainage Statement report (Ref: R001DRE-201337-17-2-Drainage Statement Issue Number 01) and the overall site peak discharge rate is restricted to 1 l/s.REASON: To address adaptation to, and mitigation of, climate change; provide sustainable urban drainage and manage surface water run-off in a critical drainage area as close to source as possible; enhance biodiversity values; and improve the appearance and resilience of the development.

No development shall take place until a Construction Method Statement covering the matters set out below has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall only be implemented in accordance with the details and measures approved as part of the construction method statement, which shall be maintained throughout the entire construction period. 1) How vehicles and equipment will travel to and from the site; what route they will take to avoid harm to trees and their root protection areas;2) A summary of the vehicles and equipment to be used.REASON: In the interest of protecting trees and landscaping assets.

Following the removal of any category C trees, each tree shall be replaced by one of a suitable species within the site unless first agreed otherwise by the Local Planning Authority.  The replacement trees shall be planted during the planting season current at the time of felling (end October - end March) or during the next immediately available planting season.  The size of the trees shall be at least a Selected Standard as per BS 3936-1:1992 (or any standard that reproduces or replaces this standard).  The trees shall be maintained for 5 years after planting and should they be removed, die, be severely damaged or become seriously diseased within this period they shall be replaced with another tree as originally required to be planted by this condition.REASON: To enhance the character, appearance and ecology of the development and contribution to green infrastructure and in the interests of visual amenity, having regard to Policy LP51 of Hackney Local Plan.

Tree protection for all retained trees at the site and on adjacent land shall be undertaken in accordance with BS5837:2012 (Trees in relation to construction - Recommendations) and will protect the root protection area calculated as described in Table 2 of that British Standard for the duration of all site works (including demolition) undertaken in connection with the development hereby approved. The protective fencing will be 2.4m high and conform to Figure 2 of BS5837:2012 i.e. a scaffold framework comprising a vertical and horizontal framework, well braced to resist impacts, with vertical tubes spaced at a maximum interval of 3m. On to this weldmesh panels should be securely fixed with wire or scaffold clamps. Tree protection should take into account the existing and proposed level changes and ensure that retained trees are not negatively impacted by any proposed excavation.REASON: In the interest of protecting trees and landscaping assets.

<p>Detailed drawings/full particulars of the proposed development showing the matters set out below must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before the development proceeds beyond ground level. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved: </p><p>a) Details of the brick to be used on the external surfaces of the pavilion; </p><p>b) Details of the boundary fence and gates; </p><p>c) Detailed drawings of the kiosk shutters, which should be of an open mesh tube link portcullis type, with an internal shutter box. </p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the development is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the Clissold Park conservation area and in the interest of preserving historic elements of importance.</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
